isis.stitle: TSI 00-08-09R - Electrical Circuit Revision for the Optimized Idle System to Prevent Unnecessary Battery Drain in 9000i Models Built Before January 7, 2000 at Garland, May 9, 2000 at Chatham, and August 14, 2000 at Escobedo

subjectgroup.subject: Electrical Circuit Revision for the Optimized Idle System to Prevent Unnecessary Battery Drain in 9000i Models Built Before January 7, 2000 at Garland, May 9, 2000 at Chatham, and August 14, 2000 at Escobedo

geninfo.para: The Optimized Idle System in 9000i Models built before January 7, 2000 at Garland, May 9, 2000 at Chatham, and August 14, 2000 at Escobedo may be starting the engine more frequently than necessary due to unnecessary loads on the battery when the engine is not running.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure for All Models Without Eaton AutoShift Transmissions

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect the negative battery cable.
Remove glove box and right dash panel.
Unbolt the fuse block and carefully pull forward to gain access to the rear side of the fuse panel.
Locate and cut circuit 13-GA at relay 462M (at the fuse block), cavity R2-2, as close as possible to the terminal (Figure 1).

note.para: Circuit 13-GA from relay 462M, cavity R2-2, will not be used.

step1.para: Locate and cut circuit 13-GT approximately 2 to 3 inches from connector 463M (at the fuse block), cavity R5-2 as shown in Figure 1.
Splice the two cut ends of circuit 13-GT with a 18 gauge jumper wire as shown in Figure 2.
Locate circuit 13-GA at relay 462, cavity R1-2, and splice it to the other end of the jumper wire from Step 6 (Figure 2).
Cut circuits 13U (12ga., pink), 13CP (14ga., pink) and 13AH (14ga., pink) approximately 6 inches from the splice of 13 (12ga., pink), labeled ES3, and located left of the fuse block (Figure 1).
Cut circuits 13DC (14ga., pink) and 13DA (14ga., pink) approximately 6 inches from ignition adapter 494 (splice pack), labeled I1, located to the right side behind the fuse block (Figure 1).
Splice circuits 13CP and 13AH from 13 splice labeled ES3 to circuit 13DA from the fuse block (Figure 2).
Splice circuit 13DA from ignition adapter I1 to circuits 13CP and 13AH from the fuse block (Figure 2).
Splice circuit 13U from 13 splice labeled ES3 to circuit 13DC from the fuse block (Figure 2).
Splice 13DC from ignition adapter I1 to circuit 13U from the fuse block (Figure 2).

Locate circuit 13AT between the auxiliary bunk blower relay and the HVAC control (Figure 5) and cut the circuit wire leaving adequate wire lengths to install a connector. Strip both wires and attach crimp terminal Part Number 879630R1 to each wire.

Install the two wires of circuit 13AT with crimp terminals to connector Part Number 872291R1: connect the circuit 13AT wire from the HVAC control to connector Part Number 872291R1, cavity A and the circuit 13AT wire from the auxilliary bunk blower motor to cavity B (Figure 5)

important.para: If the circuit wires are reversed in Step 15, the bunk blower will chatter or will not function.

step1.para: Install rectifier assembly, Part Number 467404C91, into connector Part Number 872291R1.
Re-install the fuse block, dash panel and glove box.
Re-connect the negative battery cable.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure for 9000 Models with Eaton AutoShift Transmissions.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect the negative battery cable.
Remove glove box and right dash panel.
Unbolt the fuse block and carefully pull forward to gain access to the rear side of the fuse panel.
Locate and cut circuit 13-GA at relay 462M (at the fuse block), cavity R2-2, as close as possible to the terminal (Figure 3).

note.para: Circuit 13-GA from relay 462M, cavity R2-2, will not be used.

step1.para: Locate and cut circuit 13-GT approximately 2 to 3 inches from connector 463M (at the fuse block), cavity R5-2 as shown in Figure 3.
Splice the two cut ends of circuit 13-GT with a 18 gauge jumper wire as shown in Figure 4.
Locate circuit 13-GA at relay 462, cavity R1-2, and splice it to the other end of the jumper wire from Step 6 (Figure 4).

important.para: There are two 13U circuits. Exercise particular care when performing modifications to circuit 13U in the following Steps.

step1.para: Cut circuits 13U (12ga., pink), 13CP (14ga., pink) and 13AH (14ga., pink) approximately 6 inches from the splice of 13 (12ga., pink), labeled ES3, and located left of the fuse block (Figure 3).
Cut circuits 13DC (14ga., pink) and 13DA (14ga., pink) approximately 6 inches from ignition adapter 494 (splice pack), labeled I1, located to the right side behind the fuse block (Figure 3).
Cut circuit 13U (16ga pink, 13U for Eaton Auto Shift at 495-F splice pack, labeled I2) as shown in Figure 3.
Splice circuit 13U from ignition adapter labeled I2 to circuit 13AH from the fuse block (Figure 4).
Splice circuit 13AH from 13 splice labeled ES3 to circuit 13U (12ga, pink) from fuse block F9-8 (Figure 4).
Splice circuit 13CP from 13 splice labeled ES3 to circuit 13DA from fuse block (Figure 4).
Splice circuit 13DA from ignition adapter I1 to circuit 13CP from the fuse block (Figure 4).
Splice circuit 13U from 13 splice labeled ES3 to circuit 13DC from the fuse block (Figure 4).
Splice circuit 13DC from ignition adapter I1 to circuit 13U (16ga, pink) from fuse block F10-1 (Figure 4).

Locate circuit 13AT between the auxiliary bunk blower relay and the HVAC control (Figure 5) and cut the circuit wire leaving adequate wire lengths to install a connector. Strip both wires and attach crimp terminal Part Number 879630R1.

Install the two wires with crimp terminals of circuit 13AT to connector Part Number 872291R1: connect the circuit 13AT wire from the HVAC control to connector Part Number 872291R1, cavity A and the circuit 13AT wire from the auxilliary bunk blower motor to cavity B (Figure 5)

important.para: If the circuit wires are reversed in Step 18, the bunk blower will chatter or will not function.

step1.para: Install rectifier assembly, Part Number 467404C91, into connector Part Number 872291R1.
Re-install the fuse block, dash panel and glove box.
Re-connect the negative battery cable.
